programme.title: News
programme.desc: The leading news stories of the moment.

programme.title: The Godfather Part II
programme.desc: (1974) De Niro and Pacino star in Francis Ford Coppola's Oscar-laden crime family drama - the greatest ever sequel? - as it explores Vito Corleone's early life and Michael's rise to power.

programme.title: Die Hard
programme.desc: (1988) Action-thriller with Bruce Willis and Alan Rickman. Can a New York cop free the hostages being held in a skyscraper by an arch villain? Yippee ki-yay... whoops, can't say that here.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: One Million Years B.C.
programme.desc: (1966) Raquel Welch - in her famous fur bikini - stars in this prehistoric adventure set in an inhospitable landscape populated by two warring tribes and Ray Harryhausen's roving dinosaurs.

programme.title: Dr Seuss' The Cat in the Hat
programme.desc: (2003) Family comedy with Mike Myers. A badly behaved boy and his super-organised sister are plunged into an anarchic adventure when a man-sized talking cat suddenly appears at their home.

programme.title: Gulliver's Travels
programme.desc: (2010) Comedy adventure. Jack Black stars as the would-be travel writer Lemuel Gulliver, who gets stranded on an island of tiny people in this updating of Jonathan Swift's classic novel.

programme.title: The Pursuit of Happyness
programme.desc: (2006) Biographical drama starring Will Smith as Chris Gardner, the down-on-his-luck salesman who risked it all to provide a better life for himself and his son.

programme.title: Independence Day: Resurgence
programme.desc: (2016) Sci-fi blockbuster sequel starring Jeff Goldblum. Twenty years after Earth repelled a devastating alien invasion, the extraterrestrials return to finish the job.

programme.title: The Godfather Coda: The Death...
programme.desc: ...of Michael Corleone: The 2020 cut of The Godfather Part III, starring Al Pacino and Diane Keaton. Michael tries to go straight and wrestles with his past.

programme.title: Gangs of New York
programme.desc: (2002) Scorsese's epic drama with Leonardo DiCaprio, Daniel Day-Lewis and Cameron Diaz. As gang warfare dictates 1860s New York, an orphan seeks revenge against his father's killer.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: BSL Zone: This Is Deaf
programme.desc: In this programme we celebrate February - the month of love - by exploring Deaf dating - covering everything from dating in the 1970s to navigating the modern dating landscape.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: The Guns of Fort Petticoat
programme.desc: (1957) Western. A Union army deserter sets out to turn his Texan hometown's womenfolk into sharpshooters in order to repel a Comanche attack. Starring Audie Murphy and Kathryn Grant.

programme.title: The War Lover
programme.desc: (1962) War film with Steve McQueen and Robert Wagner. A US pilot stationed in Britain during WWII alienates his comrades with his self-serving antics.

programme.title: Barnacle Bill
programme.desc: (1957) The final Ealing comedy stars Alec Guinness as the latest in a long and distinguished line of sailors, but there's a problem: he suffers from seasickness. So why not buy a pier?

programme.title: Hell Is a City
programme.desc: (1960) Classic crime thriller with Stanley Baker and Billie Whitelaw. A world-weary detective with a messy private life tracks a violent thief through the streets of Manchester.

programme.title: Nomadland
programme.desc: (2020) BAFTA, Golden Globe and Oscar-winning docu-drama with Frances McDormand. A middle-aged woman with no money makes a van her home and takes to the roads of America looking for work.

programme.title: Angel Has Fallen
programme.desc: (2019) Action-thriller sequel. Secret agent Mike Banning (Gerard Butler) goes on the run when he's framed for an attack on the President. Can he clear his name?

programme.title: Corsage
programme.desc: (2022) Marie Kreutzer's tightly corseted biographical drama starring Vicky Krieps as a quietly defiant Empress Elisabeth of Austria as she turns 40 on Christmas Eve 1877. In German/subs.

programme.title: Bad Boys for Life
programme.desc: (2020) Action-comedy starring Will Smith and Martin Lawrence. Just when Marcus is planning to retire, a vengeful drug lord's son shoots Mike. Can our dynamic duo beat the cartel?

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Saraband for Dead Lovers
programme.desc: (1948) Historical drama starring Joan Greenwood and Stewart Granger. Princess Dorothea marries the future king of England. But then she meets a Swedish count...

programme.title: Gideon of Scotland Yard
programme.desc: (1958) Drama. Jack Hawkins stars as Police Inspector Gideon, who faces outrage and danger in his quest to bring London's criminals to justice. With Anna Massey, John Loder and Cyril Cusack.

programme.title: Anastasia
programme.desc: (1956) Historical drama. The Oscar-winning Ingrid Bergman stars as an amnesiac refugee who Yul Brynner tries to pass off as the daughter of the murdered Tsar of Russia, Nicholas II.

programme.title: 3:10 to Yuma
programme.desc: (1957) Classic western with Glenn Ford and Van Heflin. The capture of a murderous stagecoach robber propels an impoverished local rancher on a perilous journey. Directed by Delmer Daves.

programme.title: School of Rock
programme.desc: (2003) Jack Black cranks the comedy up to 11. A slacker rock musician blags his way into a posh school and enrols a bunch of 10-year-olds into a full-scale Battle of the Bands.

programme.title: Everything Everywhere All at Once
programme.desc: (2022) Darkly comic sci-fi action thriller with Michelle Yeoh. A laundromat owner's drab existence becomes much more exciting when she must traverse the multiverse to defeat an evil force.

programme.title: The Eyes of Tammy Faye
programme.desc: (2021) Jessica Chastain puts in a barnstorming performance as the glitzy televangelist in the kind of real-life rise and fall that just seems made for the movies. With Andrew Garfield.

programme.title: The Godfather Part II
programme.desc: (1974) De Niro and Pacino star in Francis Ford Coppola's Oscar-laden crime family drama - the greatest ever sequel? - as it explores Vito Corleone's early life and Michael's rise to power.

programme.title: Die Hard
programme.desc: (1988) Action-thriller with Bruce Willis and Alan Rickman. Can a New York cop free the hostages being held in a skyscraper by an arch villain? Yippee ki-yay... whoops, can't say that here.

programme.title: One Million Years B.C.

programme.title: Dr Seuss' The Cat in the Hat
programme.desc: (2003) Family comedy with Mike Myers. A badly behaved boy and his super-organised sister are plunged into an anarchic adventure when a man-sized talking cat suddenly appears at their home.

programme.title: Gulliver's Travels
programme.desc: (2010) Comedy adventure. Jack Black stars as the would-be travel writer Lemuel Gulliver, who gets stranded on an island of tiny people in this updating of Jonathan Swift's classic novel.

programme.title: The Pursuit of Happyness
programme.desc: (2006) Biographical drama starring Will Smith as Chris Gardner, the down-on-his-luck salesman who risked it all to provide a better life for himself and his son.

programme.title: Independence Day: Resurgence
programme.desc: (2016) Sci-fi blockbuster sequel starring Jeff Goldblum. Twenty years after Earth repelled a devastating alien invasion, the extraterrestrials return to finish the job.

programme.title: The Godfather Coda: The Death...
programme.desc: ...of Michael Corleone: The 2020 cut of The Godfather Part III, starring Al Pacino and Diane Keaton. Michael tries to go straight and wrestles with his past.

programme.title: Gangs of New York
programme.desc: (2002) Scorsese's epic drama with Leonardo DiCaprio, Daniel Day-Lewis and Cameron Diaz. As gang warfare dictates 1860s New York, an orphan seeks revenge against his father's killer.

programme.title: The War Lover
programme.desc: (1962) War film with Steve McQueen and Robert Wagner. A US pilot stationed in Britain during WWII alienates his comrades with his self-serving antics.

programme.title: Barnacle Bill

programme.title: Hell Is a City

programme.title: Nomadland

programme.title: Angel Has Fallen

programme.title: Bad Boys for Life

programme.title: English Football League Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the latest matches, including Sunderland v Hull City at Stadium of Light, Swansea City v Blackburn Rovers at Swansea.com Stadium and Portsmouth v Queens Park Rangers at Fratton Park in the Championship

programme.title: Next Level Chef USA
programme.desc: The teams sharpen their knives for a new challenge: preparing the ultimate steak dinner to avoid the first knockout competition.

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: The Royal Beat
programme.desc: Kate Thornton is joined by ITV News Royal Editor Chris Ship, Vanity Fair's Royal Correspondent Katie Nicholl, and royal commentator Afua Hagan to discuss all of the latest news surrounding the royal family

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host the nationwide talent search, which sees a wide variety of acts, from comedians to contortionists, singers to spoon players, compete for the chance to win a cash prize of 250,000 and a coveted slot at the Royal Variety Performance. Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and Bruno Tonioli return to the judging panel with special guest judge KSI

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: The chef invites Ben and Georgie Ainslie into his kitchen to sample some recipes from Cyrus Todiwala and Jose Pizarro. Merlin Griffiths is at the bar crafting cocktails

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Felicity Kendal, Nigel Havers and Jessica Hynes join Alan and Meirion Owen gives a lesson in sheepdog training. Camilla Bassett-Smith and Chris Hull spruce up the green house and Ian Burrell makes rum cocktails for all seasons

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: In Leicestershire, Alan and the team head to the town of Hinckley to surprise 96-year-old Second World War veteran Gordon with a stunning garden transformation. Alan sets about bringing a classic beautiful English country garden to this inaccessible space that includes raised beds in dry stone walls, a sociable seating area, a mini-orchard and an outdoor room

programme.title: Nisha Katona's Home Kitchen
programme.desc: The restaurateur cooks a mushroom monsoon curry with grapes, some barbecued corn on the cob and a cote de boeuf with chilli rub. She also visits a local butcher who has been in business in the area for over 180 years

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Pictionary
programme.desc: Jeanette Kwakye and Eddie Kadi lead contestants on a mission to draw images that match a word or phrase from a specific category. The team-mates will have to guess correctly to score. Game show, hosted by Mel Giedroyc

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: Italy v France (Kick-off 3.00pm). Jill Douglas presents coverage of the concluding match in the third round of fixtures, which takes place at Stadio Olimpico in Rome. Italy narrowly missed out on a historic victory at Stade Pierre-Mauroy in Lille last year when Paolo Garbisi's injury-time penalty hit the post after the ball fell off the tee and resulted in a rushed attempt to beat the shot clock, and the encounter ended in a 13-13 draw. The previous meeting in Rome two years ago also appeared to be going in favour of the Azzurri as they led 24-22 in the second half, only for a Matthieu Jalibert try to dash their hopes in a 29-24 loss. With analysis from Brian O'Driscoll, Jamie Roberts and Benjamin Kayser, pitchside reports by Gabriel Clarke and Sergio Parisse, and commentary by Miles Harrison, Nolli Waterman, and David Flatman

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals
programme.desc: Compilation of some of the most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shephard, in which the last contestant standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: Holly Willoughby and Stephen Mulhern host as the five remaining couples perform routines inspired by well-known musicals in hope of securing a place in the semi-final. Plus, Michael Ball and Alfie Boe open the show and the cast of Moulin Rouge! The Musical bring the West End to the ice

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson hosts a celebrity version of the big-prize quiz in which Laura Kenny and Krishnan Guru-Murthy answer questions to win cash for their chosen charities. If they get stuck, they have four lifelines available, including Ask the Audience, Phone a Friend and 50-50

programme.title: Unforgotten
programme.desc: Lies are uncovered as Mel and Asif are taken into custody, Juliet tries to protect Taylor and herself against the investigation, a possible witness to the body's disposal is found, and Jess plans a conversation with Steve

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Knight and Day
programme.desc: Action adventure starring Tom Cruise and Cameron Diaz. A chance encounter at an airport with spy Roy Miller embroils mechanic June Havens in a frantic and life-threatening chase across the globe. But can June really trust this man of mystery, especially given his penchant for rendering her unconscious when trouble rears its head?

programme.title: Nisha Katona's Home Kitchen
programme.desc: The restaurateur cooks a mushroom monsoon curry with grapes, some barbecued corn on the cob and a cote de boeuf with chilli rub. She also visits a local butcher who has been in business in the area for over 180 years

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Fletchers' Family Farm
programme.desc: Kelvin is in the market for a bull in his mission to expand the cow herd and Marnie checks in on her Jacob's sheep, with plans to put the tup in soon as she plans ahead for lambing season. Milo, Kelvin and his dad start to work on an old vintage tractor that they bought for the twins in a second-hand sale, and the Fletchers celebrate another successful year on the farm by inviting all their friends over to say thank you

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Early morning chat show presented by Lorraine Kelly, with celebrity interviews, entertainment news, cooking tips, fashion features and musical guests.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Celebrity interviews and studio discussion from a female perspective

programme.title: ITV Lunchtime News
programme.desc: The key headlines from the day so far

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson and his team of antiques dealers are at Walsall Football Club in the West Midlands where they meet a young seller whose technique to get the best price for her gold is to 'just keep saying no', Tim Hogarth pays nearly four times the expected amount for a family jewellery collection and a seller brings in a collection of 400 First World War postcards

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Adil Ray in which three pairs of contestants use their powers of deduction to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. Looking for the winning words today are folk music-loving couple Tim and Kim, mother and daughter Nicola and Tia-Dene and Gloucestershire couple Dawn and Simon

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Olly from Essex, Michelle from Northampton, Carl from Birmingham and Laura from Bristol pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: A crisis meeting takes place, there is suspicion over Noah's drugging, and a vigil is held.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Daisy reveals the identity of her baby's father, Todd encounters Julie again, Cassie gets up to her old tricks, and Betsy tries to keep Dylan positive about the future

programme.title: Unforgotten
programme.desc: Jess and Sunny finally get the truth from Asif, Marty, Mel and Juliet as Gerry Cooper's killer is revealed. However, the outcome leads to difficult decisions both on and off the case

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Current affairs programme delving into stories beyond the headlines. Featuring live studio debates and comprehensive analysis, it sheds light on key stories impacting the nation and its surroundings

programme.title: Keane & Vieira - Best of Enemies
programme.desc: The on-field rivalry between midfielders Roy Keane and Patrick Vieira during their time at Manchester United and Arsenal respectively, when they strived for dominance in a golden period for the clubs. There was no love lost between the two combative players, who captained their teams and enjoyed many memorable battles in the quest for Premier League glory. In this programme, Gabriel Clarke interviews both men

programme.title: It's Showtime!
programme.desc: Documentary telling the story of a group of working-class men from the north-east of England who got drunk one night and bought a racehorse - a decision that would change their lives forever

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Adil Ray hosts as three pairs of contestants call upon their powers of deduction in a battle of words, with the last remaining duo given the chance to double their winnings or leave with nothing. programme.title: Emmerdale

programme.title: The Martin Lewis Money Show: Live
programme.desc: The cash expert answers the financial questions that matter most, and offers tips and tricks for making finances go further

programme.title: The Real Unforgotten
programme.desc: The detectives unravel long-forgotten secrets and have a potential circumstantial case against two suspects, but they need more to prove their case in court - fortunately, they get a breakthrough after an appeal for new witnesses with testimony that changes everything. Can the detectives finally uncover what happened to Carol?

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Scotland Tonight Special
programme.desc: Current affairs programme delving into stories beyond the headlines. Featuring live studio debates and comprehensive analysis, it sheds light on key stories impacting the nation and its surroundings

programme.title: Glitter: The Popstar Paedophile
programme.desc: Exploring the dual life of performer and predatory abuser Gary Glitter, documenting his crimes against children committed both in the UK and internationally and investigating the failures to bring him to justice. Including historical victim testimony, archive footage and interviews with those who met him and the lawyers involved in both the prosecution and defence of Gary Glitter during various different trials

programme.title: The Murder of Bianca Devins: Social Media Murders
programme.desc: A young woman in upstate New York is murdered and the killer posts footage of his heinous crime all over social media - when her family are sent the gruesome images of the crime before the police have had a chance to confirm what has happened, the family are then forced to battle social media platforms to remove the awful evidence from the internet

programme.desc: In Leicestershire, Alan and the team head to the town of Hinckley to surprise 96-year-old Second World War veteran Gordon with a stunning garden transformation. programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: Italy v France (Kick-off 3.00pm). Jill Douglas presents coverage of the concluding match in the third round of fixtures, which takes place at Stadio Olimpico in Rome. Italy narrowly missed out on a historic victory at Stade Pierre-Mauroy in Lille last year when Paolo Garbisi's injury-time penalty hit the post after the ball fell off the tee and resulted in a rushed attempt to beat the shot clock, and the encounter ended in a 13-13 draw. The previous meeting in Rome two years ago also appeared to be going in favour of the Azzurri as they led 24-22 in the second half, only for a Matthieu Jalibert try to dash their hopes in a 29-24 loss. With analysis from Brian O'Driscoll, Jamie Roberts and Benjamin Kayser, pitchside reports by Gabriel Clarke and Sergio Parisse, and commentary by Miles Harrison, Nolli Waterman, and David Flatman

programme.title: WW2 - Battles for Europe
programme.desc: Battle for Caen: This edition examines the efforts of the British and Canadians who fought elite German divisions to capture the city of Caen, the key to breaking out of Normandy.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Minehead Railway Station 2: Fiona Bruce presents from Minehead Railway Station, where items brought in include a chair thought to have once belonged to Henry VIII.

programme.title: How Britain Worked
programme.desc: Guy Martin and a team from the Black Country Living Museum restore a Newcomen engine, an 18th-century steam-powered device used principally to pump water out of mines.

programme.title: Bangers & Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: Astra: A sun-bleached red Vauxhall Astra GTE gives the team a headache. They also buy a classic French moped and catch up on the restoration of a barn find Mini Cooper S.

programme.title: Bangers & Cash
programme.desc: Derek heads to Doncaster to collect four vintage BSAs motorbikes including one said to be the rarest BSA of all.

programme.title: Bangers & Cash
programme.desc: Derek heads to Suffolk to collect two Bentleys with a majestic pedigree; Cynthia a stunning 1963 S3 and Harry, a 1965 Continental.
